intro: Biscutella valentina subsp. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience and ecological significance in its native habitat.
